definition: variant character/loan word/variant written form (for the same word)/different edition

sentences.english: The "field work" has become a must due to ethnology's focus on the exotic culture.
sentences.chinese: 民族學對於異文化的關注使“田野工作”成爲必然。“

sentences.english: Variants in the sense of philology mainly refer to characters capable of replacing each other or variants of Chinese characters.
sentences.chinese: 作爲文字學意義上的異文，主要是指通假字和異體字。

sentences.english: The development of national culture goes side by side with the assimilation of foreign culture.
sentences.chinese: 民族文化的發展歷程伴隨與異文化的融匯過程。

sentences.english: Deciphering the Inscriptions on the bronze ware with the help of their variant forms is a method worthy of our attention.
sentences.chinese: 利用異文去校讀銅器銘文，是一種值得重視的方法。

sentences.english: There exist plenty of variants in the Chinese language.
sentences.chinese: 漢字中有大量的異文存在。

sentences.english: Therefore whether first Qin history spread at all the books of Zhuzi take shape heferographs a lot of.
sentences.chinese: 因而與先秦史傅和諸子之書形成很多異文。

sentences.english: Both social and cultural factors contribute to the emergence of variants.
sentences.chinese: 異文的產生，往往有社會和文化的因素在裏面。

sentences.english: In Andrews's first variant, the bridegroom turns into a toad.
sentences.chinese: 在安德魯斯的第一種異文裏，新郎變成了癩蛤蟆。

definition: to copy (a text) from person to person/(of a text) to be transmitted by copying
to annotate/to add marginal comments on/criticism/marginalia
study of classic texts, including interpretation, glossaries and commentaries
to interpret and make glossaries and commentaries on classic texts
Yi Zhuan, commentary on the "Book of Changes" or "I Ching" 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1]
